content: This contribution hasn’t received enough positive votes from the community. The "SHORTEST" option has therefore been deactivated.

https://leetcode.com/problems/trapping-rain-water/

This is too complicated for 15 minutes.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Seems simple enough and similar to exercises I have encountered before in CoC.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Problem isn't that complicated if you think about it for a while. The hardest part is to identify the holes, but if you've read the tip, shouldn't be hard to code. Might not have a very high success percentage but is reasonably easy to have some players finish it in time. However, if people start overthinking it, 15 min may be too short.
nice work

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It was fun to do, I think it would make a great clash :)

Also, the tip was quite useful

--
An overcomplicator

Gave it a try, with a timer set to 12mins (as I already spent some time to read the statement).

I'd say, its too hard to solve it within 12 mins. especially if you are not using Python. 

Try to solve this with php :D
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

This is quite an easy problem that can be coded in a few lines. I like it as a simple puzzle. 15min should be enough for a big portion of codingame users.

I would make the text a little bit clearer. 
1. use some whitespace areas. 
2. avoid the word sinkhole, non native speakers might not understand that.
The problem is really interesting. For anyone who does not overcomplicate things, it is easy to solve. I would say this is OK for a CoC, after all, there is a 15 minutes time limit for solving it.
First thought it's too complicated, but think a little and got a beautiful and simple solution, so okay let it be in CoC, we need hard clashes!
I think this would be easy enough for CoC if you changed it so that there is always only one lake. The way it currently is it would be better as a puzzle. Cool idea though!
Its a nice leetcode question, but too hard for coc imo.
Clearly too complex for a CoC, the idea is cool but in 15 min it will be too hard, majority of clash are completed in 4-5 lines maximum.

I like the problem, but I think it should be a puzzle instead of a Clash due to time constraints.

Your solution was not the one I came up with, and it took me some time to pass all the tests due to some cases I did not think of right away. I tried to program this as if I were in a real Clash and, in my case, I don't always come with the simplest solution, but what seems more obvious to me. Took me a bit more than the 15 minutes. I usually finish the Clashes I play.

I am going to downvote just for this reason since I cannot think of a way that could make this problem faster to solve. 

But I really like the idea.

I liked it, although I'm not sure I could come up with that short solution in 15 minutes. My solution was basically to "construct" the montains by row and see how much water would go into them.

For the two people who downvoted, at least comment why you downvoted so the creator can improve the problem.

Note: My first contribution! Sorry in advance for the English mistakes, I can correct them if you point some of them out.
I hope it is not too complex to understand and to solve. I am submitting it for a CoC since the solution is very fast to write once you found it.

Thank you for your feedback ! Of course I would like to know if I got downvotes for the same reasons ^^
You confirmed that the simplest solution is not the most intuitive one. The only correction I am thinking of is adding a tip "You should consider computing the volume column by column to get a solution simple enough" (I edited the statement). Then the remaining questions are
1) Will the tip be convincing enough to make a player look at this way ?
2) Is it CoC friendly ? If a player doesn't read the tip, is it his fault or the fault of the statement ?
Thank you for sharing your opinion! Since everyone agrees with the fact that it is too complex for a CoC, I will re-submit this statement as a puzzle.
Thank you for sharing your opinion! Since everyone agrees with the fact that it is too complex for a CoC, I will re-submit this statement as a puzzle.

Thank you for your feedback and your suggestion. However I don't really see which algorithm could work for one lake without working with multiple lakes. I would say your suggestion is a "high-level" constraint, not directly constraining the input. That is, I think an algorithm that works on inputs representing one lake is likely to work with multiple lakes... I may be wrong, if you can provide an idea of an simple algorithm that supports your suggestion.

Thank you for your support. Since you and some other people finally think it is suitable for a CoC (and the score is now positive), I will submit this statement for validation once the WIP time will be over, as well as the puzzle version. We will see if more people would like it to be rejected or approved.

Thank you for your support. Since you and some other people finally think it is suitable for a CoC (and the score is now positive), I will submit this statement for validation once the WIP time will be over, as well as the puzzle version. We will see if more people would like it to be rejected or approved.
Thank you. You're right, I changed "sinkhole" "to hole". About whitespace areas, do you mean blank lines ? I added of them, but if you were thinking about another thing, feel free to edit !

Thank you for giving it a try ! As you can see with the older comments and the upvotes/downvotes, opinions differ on the fact it is short enough for a CoC. Also, I quite disagree with the fact that the difficulty will depend a lot on the coding language because the "simple solution" is only one loop and some min/max, that is not much more complicated than the average CoC. I think the question is how much time we need to find this "simple solution"...
I submitted it for a CoC since some people found it short enough for it, but if this submission is not approved, I will resubmit the puzzle version. I only hope that one of the two versions will be approved :p (too long for a CoC, too short for a puzzle...)

Hi, indeed, it seems I am not the only one who thought about this problem. I am already struggling with the already existing contributions in CodinGame, I will not search on Leetcode too :p

About the duration, if it is too long for a CoC, some people should have rejected the puzzle before other ones approved it... As I said below (to Snake_Tn), I would have resubmitted a puzzle version of this statement in that case.
Much more readable. Great. I accept it as is right now.
Never mind you're right, the easy solution I thought of wouldn't even work and I can't find an easy one that works for one but not for multiple

As you can see, it seems like it's a general idea that its not quite suited for Clash. I would consider ditch the tip and re-submit as a classic puzzle.
Just let people take their time because it is indeed a nice puzzle to think about
It seems indeed that everyone agrees with that. I will re-submit this statement as a puzzle soon!
